The Voice of America is unique among these activities in that its mes¬
sage is the only one to penetrate the Iron and Bamboo Curtains behind which
approximately 60C million of the earth's people live* They constitute VOA’s
principal ”target audience®*8 VGA also differs from the Government's other
information activities in that it speaks directly from America to the listener,
rather than being relayed through distant field offices*
Ttfho listens to the Voice?
Fortunately, radio is well established as a source of information even
in relatively underdeveloped areas. The best available estimates are that
there are approximately 100 million radio receivers in the world outside
North America. These provide VOA with a potential audience of about ijOO million
persons — an audience which is greatly expanded if word of mouth and other
secondary distribution are taken into account.
